answers.answer: People fleeing the war in Ukraine benefit from the basic service package, including medical assistance, medicines, and medical devices, similar to Romanian insured persons. They also have access to medicines, sanitary materials, medical devices, and services within national curative health programs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The rights granted by the Romanian social health insurance system to people fleeing the war in Ukraine'.

answers.answer: Individuals from Ukraine requesting medical services for the first time are registered by providers in an IT application from the National Health Insurance House, which assigns them an identification number in the social health insurance system.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Registration in the social health insurance system for people coming from the armed conflict area in Ukraine'.

answers.answer: The identification number allows patients to use the printed document at any medical unit in Romania without needing a subsequent generation of an identification number. This document is handed to the beneficiary after registration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Registration in the social health insurance system for people coming from the armed conflict area in Ukraine'.

answers.answer: The basic service package includes medical services, medicines, and medical devices. These are provided by a family doctor or specialist doctor, either in ambulatory settings or in a hospital.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The basic service package'.

answers.answer: For people from Ukraine, the family doctor is the first contact with the health system. They provide any medical service included in the basic medical services package without requiring these individuals to be registered on their own patient list.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Family doctor'.

answers.answer: Curative medical services include services for medical emergencies and consultations for acute conditions, such as minor surgery or specific maneuvers. Consultations for diseases with endemoepidemic potential that require isolation can also be given remotely.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Curative medical services'.

answers.answer: Preventive services are offered at specific intervals for ages 0-3 years, once a year for 4-18 years, once every 3 years for 18-39 years (or annually for high-risk individuals), and annually for those 40+ years (or once every 3 years for uninsured persons).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Preventive Services'.

answers.answer: Family doctors can perform services such as spirometry, 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure measurement, ECG, aerosol medication administration, intramuscular, intravenous, and subcutaneous treatments, and surgical treatment for conditions like abscesses or skin lesions.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Family doctor'.

answers.answer: Home consultations are available for people who cannot move, patients with chronic diseases or acute conditions preventing travel, children 0-1 year, and children 0-18 years with infectious-contagious diseases. Remote consultations are for patients with chronic diseases and those with endemic-epidemic potential requiring isolation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Counseling at home or remotely'.

answers.answer: A family doctor can issue referral tickets for specialist consultations, medical prescriptions, medical leave certificates, medical certificates for children in case of illness, and recommendations for home medical care or certain prosthetic devices.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Family doctor'.

answers.answer: People from Ukraine in special situations benefit from the social health insurance system without paying the social health insurance contribution, the personal contribution for outpatient medicines, and with exemption from co-payment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The rights granted by the Romanian social health insurance system to people fleeing the war in Ukraine'.

answers.answer: Patients with chronic diseases can receive periodic consultations on an appointment basis to continue therapy and monitor their disease evolution. They can have one consultation per month with the family doctor, either in the office or remotely.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Patients with chronic diseases'.

answers.answer: An up-to-date list of family doctors in Bucharest and their contact details can be found and downloaded directly from the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'List of family doctor in Bucharest'.
